tag_professor: SO MANY PAPERS (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Caring (1)  Inspirational (1)  Get ready to read (1)
stu_tags: SO MANY PAPERS  GET READY TO READ  SKIP CLASS? YOU WON\'T PASS.
comments: The reading was interesting, and he was a decent grader, if he remembered to grade our papers. He was frequently late, forgot to give assignments, and lost some students\' papers. The extra service hours would have been fine, had he not restricted the class\'s options. He\'s a very interesting and experienced professor, but very disorganized.

tag_professor: SO MANY PAPERS (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Caring (1)  Inspirational (1)  Get ready to read (1)
comments: A great an interesting person, although not always the most natural when it comes to leading a class. Overall he is certainly good, and he is a great person to know and keep in contact with after you take his class. He has some really interesting life experiences too. Somewhat difficult grader, but not unreasonable.

tag_professor: SO MANY PAPERS (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Caring (1)  Inspirational (1)  Get ready to read (1)
comments: Do not take the contemporary Richmond class. A lot of the material is boring and class consists of discussing the material. He is probably the most awkward professor I have met thus far. Takes random pauses in the middle of sentences, and questions students in rapid succession causing no one to want to participate. Grades papers harshly. I don\'t think anyone in class has gotten higher than a B+ yet. The class involved 3 hour field trips into the city that are pretty pointless. Don\'t take him.

tag_professor: SO MANY PAPERS (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Caring (1)  Inspirational (1)  Get ready to read (1)
comments: Amazing man, I aspire to be more like him every day. It\'s a tough course, but I can not stress the amount of incredible information you will learn and how your perspective will change after this course. DEFINITELY go to Thad during office hours, or meet him at Boatwright! He\'s amazing to just talk to and is honestly concerned with his students.

tag_professor: SO MANY PAPERS (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Caring (1)  Inspirational (1)  Get ready to read (1)
comments: Excellent professor. a ton of reading but if you actually do it then you will be fine in the class. Thad\'s one of my favorite teacher\'s at richmond and i highly recommend him.

tag_professor: SO MANY PAPERS (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Caring (1)  Inspirational (1)  Get ready to read (1)
comments: heavy reading load but most of it is interesting. keeps people engaged during class. at first sight he looks like he belongs up in the mountains but he\'s a brilliant professor

tag_professor: SO MANY PAPERS (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Caring (1)  Inspirational (1)  Get ready to read (1)
comments: I\'m in love. Dr.Williamson is the most quirky man I have ever met and I loved every minute of it. He is very unassuming and humble even though he is clearly brilliant. Somewhat of an idealist but that has just made me more optimistic. Do the readings! They are hard but will enlighten you and you will bring so much more to class having read.

tag_professor: SO MANY PAPERS (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Caring (1)  Inspirational (1)  Get ready to read (1)
comments: the typical absent-minded professor.. ridiculously brilliant, and very amusing: he always has chalk on his shirt/pants, wears unmatching socks, and once even wore two different shoes to class. But he\'s so helpful and really wants people to understand what he\'s talking about.

tag_professor: SO MANY PAPERS (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Caring (1)  Inspirational (1)  Get ready to read (1)
comments: Awesome professor and one of the smartest men I have met. Makes you work and struggle but in turn you learn so much. He is willing to help with anything and is always inspiring.

tag_professor: SO MANY PAPERS (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Caring (1)  Inspirational (1)  Get ready to read (1)
comments: excellent teacher. He really challenges his students to do critical thinking. There is a lot of reading (in justice and civil society) but most of it interesting and worth getting through. Class is discussion based and is usually very engaging. Williamson is a brilliant man and I loved taking this class from him.

tag_professor: SO MANY PAPERS (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Caring (1)  Inspirational (1)  Get ready to read (1)
comments: Outstanding professor; excellent course. His door is open and he is in his office A LOT willing to talk with students about anything. He will loan you extra books to read on any subject you have questions about or are interested in. He is apparently incapable of keeping his shirt tucked in or wearing matching socks, but he\'s brilliant and funny.

tag_professor: SO MANY PAPERS (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Caring (1)  Inspirational (1)  Get ready to read (1)
comments: Intelligent but sometimes has trouble conveying his ideas. Some of the best readings you\'ll have in any class in terms of breadth and variety. Unlike a lot of professors, he isn\'t afraid to state his beliefs although he doesn\'t force them on others. Very discussion oriented. Notes are primarily lists. Class not worthwhile unless you read.

tag_professor: SO MANY PAPERS (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Caring (1)  Inspirational (1)  Get ready to read (1)
comments: I love this professor! He assigns readings that are long and semi-difficult sometimes, but nothing that you shouldn\'t be able to handle as a Leadership Major/Minor. He is INCREDIBLY smart, really nice, great to talk to, and makes jokes during class. I\'d recommend him because he knows his material, and is definitely willing to help students anytime!

comments: VERY DIFFICULT PHILOSOPHICAL READINGS FIRST 1/2 OF SEMESTER. EASY READS ABOUT SOCIAL ISSUES. MANY PAGES PER NIGHT. VERY SMART AND KNOWLEDGEABLE. ENTERTAINING PROF AND CLASS. DIFFICULT GRADER BUT GIVES GOOD FEEDBACK. INTERESTING DISCUSSIONS. FOUNDED THE "**** DETECTION FACTOR" TO KEEP STUDENTS THINKING CRITICALLY. HARD WORK BUT WORTH IT.
